bibl.title: James Robinson v. Territory of Washington. Warrant.
bibl.note: Our transcription is based on a digital image of the microfilmed original.

msIdentifier.repository: Washington State Archives, Eastern Regional Branch
msIdentifier.collection: Walla Walla County Government; Clerk, Territorial Court Civil/Criminal Case Files, 1860-1890

div1.p: Territory of Washington County of Walla Walla } s.s.
To the sheriff or any Constable of said county

Whereas, G.H. Porter, has this day complained in writing under oath to the undersigned one of the justices of the peace in and for the said County that on or about the 12th day of June 1862 at the said county that affiant verily Believes that the crime of grand larceny has been committed. Charging one James Robertson of having Committed said Crime.
Therefore in the name of the United States you are commanded to forthwith apprehend the said said James Robertson and bring him Before me to be dealt with according to law
Sworn under my hand June the 19th 1862
div1.ab: W.P. Horton Justice of the Peace
div1.p: Trial to take place at 2 O'Clock this 20th day of June Jm Buckley Sheriff
